description: This module will explore the tense history of an idea the rule of the people. From the trial and death of Socrates, in Classical Athens, to QAnon, we will discuss the reasons why so many political thinkers have long been sceptical about democracy. We will also see how, despite its many challenges, democracy has been able to adapt, improve, and thrive, at least up to now.
title: Democracy and Its Discontents (Athens to the Present)
prerequisite: Two courses in either PPE or Philosophy, or permission by the instructor.
